articles.title: Covid-19 infection creates immunity for at least six months, says study - Malay Mail
articles.description: LONDON, Nov 21 ― Individuals infected with coronavirus are unlikely to catch the illness again for at least six months, researchers at the University of Oxford said yesterday. The finding comes as part of a large-scale study into Covid-19 reinfection after ob…
articles.content: The WHO said it is working with 50 countries where studies on antibody responses in different groups, such as in the general population or among healthcare workers, were taking place. IStock.com/AFP … [+2404 chars]

articles.title: One third of Saskatchewan residents would get COVID-19 vaccine immediately: poll - Global News
articles.description: Saskatchewan residents are more hesitant than not when it comes to getting a coronavirus vaccine, according to an Angus Reid Institute poll.
articles.content:
Saskatchewan is expecting to receive close to 180,000 doses of the coronavirus vaccine early next year.

articles.title: Arctic Lockdown: COVID-19 Climbs In Canada's Far North - NPR
articles.description: A large and isolated region of northeastern Canada entered a two-week lockdown as coronavirus cases creep up in areas, including largely Indigenous communities, with limited access to intensive care.
articles.content: A man wears a mask as the territory of Nunavut enters a two week mandatory restriction period in Iqaluit, Nunavut, Canada, on Wednesday. More than 80 COVID-19 cases have been identified this month in… [+3124 chars]

articles.title: Second COVID-19 wave may have peaked in France: health agency - CTV News
articles.description: France may be past the worst of its second wave of coronavirus infections, the country's health agency said Friday, warning however that protective measures should be kept in place.
